data.title: Top 10 Smartphones with most powerful CPU in 2015
data.meta_description: Buying the phone that suits you and your needs of speed, games, web browsing and camera etc is always a personal choice. The graphics performance and processor are the most important components of a…
data.text:
Buying the phone that suits you and your needs of speed, games, web browsing and camera etc is always a personal choice. The graphics performance and processor are the most important components of a Smartphone.

2015 is full of new models hitting the market with super speedy processors and top notch technology chipsets. We all have our own opinions regarding the best Smartphone. There are many companies competing for the attention of public. The manufacturers are also playing very smart to be on the top of the mobile sector.

In this article we will tell you about the fastest Smartphones of 2015 in terms of CPU. When it comes to CPU processors, they are of two type; single-core or multi-core processors. Similarly, there is also a category of phones which falls into the AnTuTu type including One Plus2 and Vodafone SP6.

Multi-core or dual core processors are high very high in speed and include double processing power. It uses latest state-of-the-art and top of the line chipset for performance.

Dual Core Vs Outscore Vs Quad Core

Most Smartphone phablets rely on octa-core and dual-core processor technology. Both the processor decides how many processor cores are embedded in a CPU.

Quad Core has 4 cores included and Octa core, as the name suggest, has the eight cores in a processor.

When discussing the mobile phones of 2015, these Multi-core processors work very fast. For example, multitasking and 3D gaming together is possible with this architecture.

The power of the CPU is determined with the number of cores in the processor. A more powerful CPU puts more loads on the battery. But extra power makes it very easy and extremely fast to browse through the websites and play videos in HD.

The processor technology has tremendously shrinked over the years. The new innovation has been summed into a single silicon chip. Qualcomm has switched to the big octa-core setup with its new Snapdragon 810 CPU. Nvidia has also produced the super processor Tegra X1. Hence, there is a lot of advancement going on in the Octa Core processors technology.

Finally a little about dual core processors. Dual-core technology is based on a CPU that includes two complete cores on a processor. The cache controllers are integrated onto a single integrated circuit (silicon chip). Dual-core processors provide good multitasking and speedy calculations. The cores have been doubled as compared to the single core processors; each operates with its own bus.

The modern operating systems like Android have the perfect capability to handle these processors well.

Now, take a look at the devices of 2015 with stunning CPU’s;

iPhone 6S Plus

iPhone 6S Plus is ranked as the best Smartphone of 2015 by many users worldwide. It is the most favorite choice of iPhone lovers. Apple has done exceptionally well with the new phone in terms of design, speed and processing power. It comes with a 2 GB RAM which is bit low as compared to other Smartphone in the list.

The Beauty of Cortex A9

The amazing processor technology Apple relies is A9 Cortex processor. The ARM Cortex-A9 processor is a best choice for low-power or thermally constrained devices like Smartphones, digital television, tablets, routers and consumer appliances.

The A9 technology was introduced in 2008. It provides 50% better performance when compared to ARM Cortex-A8 processor. It is able to enhance the graphics performance with Core Link DMC dynamic memory controller. The processor is dual core with 1.84GHz CPU which guarantees high performance. No negative issues have been observed till now.

There are certainly no negative issues reported or any known complaints against this processor so far. Some users have, however, reported that it is harder to know which processor iPhone 6S Plus has under the hood.

Many users have to apply technical tricks to find out the actual processor of the iPhone 6S Plus. This is because of the reason that there are two versions of A9 processors used by Apple inside iPhone 6S and iPhone 6S plus.

Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus

Samsung Galax S6 Edge Plus is the super Smartphone of 2015. It comes with 4GB RAM which is indeed a huge memory capacity.

The Galaxy S6 Edge + looks better than other phones around. It comes with a super Exynos 7420, 8-core, quad-core 1.5 & quad-core 2.1 GHz speed. The performance is super in terms of Audio and video.

Galaxy S6 Edge plus has finger print reader and barometer which perform perfectly well with the Exynos processor. The Smartphone has passed several stress tests conducted to check the processor performance .The tests were specifically designed to stress the CPU of the phone and check the accuracy and speed of processing components. The tests indeed prove that Galaxy S6 Edge + ranks among the top ten CPU Smartphone of 2015 with super performance.

HTC One M9

Featuring a Snapdragon 810 Processor, The HTC One M9 is the well designed Smartphone of 2015.

The processor that tags along with HTC One M9 is Snapdragon 810 processor, with 64-bit computing on 8 CPU cores and leading modem capabilities. This processor has the ultimate power and speed for computing tasks. This phone is designed to completely support the most advanced connected mobile user experiences. The Snapdragon 810 processor provides the ultimate processing quality in this premium-tier Smartphone.

Galaxy Note 5

Samsung has made some bold new improvements in Galaxy Note 5. The phablet has been completely redesigned, considering the shortcomings in the previous models. The Galaxy Note 5 is only available in the United States and Canada for now. It is not yet being sold in the Europe.

With good 5.7 inches display and best quality camera, this phablet is doing well in when compared to the rivals. The Galaxy Note 5 is packed with the powerful Exynos 7420 processor. The powerful processor has eight cores. It runs very efficiently and smoothly with a clock speed of more than 2.1 GHz. In terms of RAM, it has 4 GB capacity.

The speed and memory performance is very much comparable with Sony Xperia Z5 Compact and S6 Edge+.

The great fast performance is considered to be due to 4 GB of memory. Different test also proves it. One bad thing to note is a slightly longer loading time of this phablet as compared to LG G4 and Nexus 6. Despite the fact they have slightly weaker hardware, they load faster. Samsung really need to solve this problem of loading and apps not being displayed simultaneously. It seems that the 4 GB RAM is doing less than expected. The apps are crashing and closing in the background if you try to open another app in the foreground.

Overall performance of 2.1 Ghz processor and Samsung Exynos 7420 chipset is quite good. It sure does a better job than Galaxy Note 4.

Xperia Z5 Compact

Sony Xperia Z5 Compact is unarguably the best Smartphone in the list of 2015. It has great features like long battery timings for three days or more, great flagship camera and specially designed speedy processor.

While the rest of the market has been doing experiments on their new models like making the screen size larger, Sony has been successfully doing the same thing by producing the smaller screen phones and fitting the same processor and camera from its larger flagship phones.

Talking about the speed and processing power, Sony Xperia Z5 Compact has an Octa Core Qualcomm processor with snapdragon 810. It has the storage capacity of 32 GB with MicroSD. The RAM it possess is 2GB less as compared to other latest top phones of 2015. The same Qualcomm processor is used as it was used in Z5 previously.

As proven by many different tests, the device does not face any overheating issues. The RAM has been reduced to 2GB as compared to the 3GB RAM of Xperia Z5, but, that does not create any noticeable speed problems in the new model. The battery life is unusually long and reliable. Therefore this phone is a top choice for the people needing speedy processing and professional working.

Samsung Galaxy S6

Samsung Galaxy S6 is no stranger to the Android Smartphone lovers, for the year 2015. The dual core and quad core processors are top selling accessories in the markets. Nowadays, we are having 6 to 8 different mobile processors which is quite an amazing technological breakthrough. Companies like AMD and Intel are making a big difference now in the processor technology. The Galaxy S6’s processor has a cluster of Cortex-A57 cores and a cluster of Cortex-A53 cores. The A57 is a high performance core, while the A53 has greater energy efficiency.

Samsung GalaxyS6 has a Qualcomm Snapdragon 615, which has a quad-core 1.7GHz ARM Cortex A53 cluster and a quad-core 1.0GHz A53 cluster as we discussed above.

The Exynos 7420 used in the Galaxy S6 uses four ARM Cortex-A57 cores clocked at 2.1GHz, and four Cortex-A53 cores clocked at 1.5GHz. The processor has unanimously passed all the tests for fitting great into this Android technology.

Android is a multiprocessor multitasking operating system. Android uses great technology to display the graphics to the screen which uses a good portion of the CPU time. The processor is also responsible for lots of other things running in the background. Therefore, it must be efficient in multi-tasking, scheduling, and multi-threading.

One Plus 2

One Plus2 was launched in July 2015 with a big screen of 5.5 inches. This phablet has 1.8Ghz processor with Snapdragon 810 and is backed up by huge Random Access Memory (RAM) of 4GB.

This Qualcomm Snapdragon processor is backed up by 32 GB of storage capacity. The One Plus 2 is smaller and more powerful than its predecessor. Featuring a Snapdragon 810 Processor, The OnePlus 2 is not a phone which compromises the quality. Very thought provoking technologies are used in designing this phone.

The Snapdragon 810 processor, with 64-bit computing on 8 CPU cores is superb tech to get your hands on in 2015. It provides the ultimate computing power to its users with 4K Ultra HD video display. The phone gives you an experience of tablet as well; due to its large screen.

LG G4

LG G4 is featuring a Snapdragon 808 Processor. It is another great choice for the best processor Smartphones of 2015. This popular model has a great built with the drive to create an exceptional visual experience. The 5.5 inch IPS Quantum display is supported very well by a high speed top notch technology processor.

The Snapdragon 808 processor is used in LG G4. It has 64-bit computing performance on 4 CPU cores. It supports 4K Ultra HD video streaming, up to 55MP digital photo sharing. Snapdragon 808 provides the incredible experience to the mobile users.

LG and Qualcomm Technology have collaborated to put efforts from the initial stage of the Snapdragon 808 introduction to make this amazing new LG technology possible in the market.

As stated by Dr. Paul E. Jacobs, executive chairman of Qualcomm Inc.

“The resulting G4 model from LG is a great example of how the technology has best utilized the needs of consumers.”

Galaxy Note 4

Samsung Galaxy Note 4 is also a well known Smartphone for its great specifications and capabilities. It is featuring a Snapdragon 805 Processor. This processor does a nice work enabling a vivid graphics experience and vibrant colors on the 2K Super AMOLED display.

The Snapdragon 805 technology is again a part of Galaxy Note 4. The processor is supportive for 4K ultra HD display and video capture. 3D gaming is also good to experience on this phone due to this Snapdragon technology.

Snapdragon 805 processors have a unique feature of loading the web pages instantaneously. This Snapdragon processor enhances the battery life and processing efficiency. The powerful CPU is Up to 2.7 GHz quad-core (4x Qualcomm® Krait™ 450) and GPU is Qualcomm Adreno 420 GPU. It uses 28 Hmp processor technologies with LPDDR3 memory of 800 MHz.
